titleStmt.title: Stealing Boy P2 Harran
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.
Private URIs using the assets prefix are pointers to the location of the SHAWI media assets.

spanGrp.span: One day he went to steal something big. Let’s say, he had stolen a cow, I do not know, maybe a heifer; I don’t know, maybe a ewe.
They caught him; he got caught. The soldiers caught him; in former times there were the soldiers of the pasha. When they caught him, they took him to jail and put him there. He was a thief after all!
The people also knew him; one said, “He has stolen my chicken.” Another one said, “He has stolen my cow.”
Wow, the misdeeds were so many! The pasha sentenced him to death. He said, “I will sentence you to death.”
But he was smart; the boy was a very smart guy, intelligent. I mean clever.
When they brought him to hang him he said to them, “Hey guys, you want to condemn me to death?” They said, “Yes!”
They said, “Hey brother!” I mean the Turks say, “What is your last wish?” This means what do you want to be your last [first] word? They wanted to kill him.
So, the last thing he wants, they would do it to him. “Well,” he said, “Would you bring my mother; I want to kiss her tongue.”

They said, “Okay! Go and bring him his mother!” When they had brought his mother, he said, “Mum, look, I got caught and they want to sentence me to death. Come! I want to kiss your tongue before I die.”

It is said that she said, “My son, why do you want to kiss my tongue?” He said “Mum! Your tongue is what killed me! If it was not for your tongue when I used to steal and bring everything to you, you would say, ‘Bravo! Well done!’
It is all because of your tongue. Give it to me! I want to bite this tongue off. Couldn’t you say, ‘My son, don’t do it!’?”

And he bit off her tongue; he pulled her tongue out and suddenly bit her tongue off, his mother’s tongue. After he had bitten off his mother’s tongue, the pasha said, “Well, brother!” He said, “Fine!”
Then the pasha said, “Hey you, how do you want me to kill you? How do you want us to kill you? Should we cut your head?
How should we cut (it), I mean, should we hit you with the sword? Or should we poison you? Or should we throw you to the snakes, to the scorpions in the dungeon?”
“Well,” he said, “As you wish, you know it better.” The pasha said, “Brother, we let you (show us how) we will kill you.”
He said, “Well, bring me a chicken!” They brought a chicken and gave the chicken to him; they gave the chicken to him.
The pasha said to him, “Here you are, brother! The way you kill this chicken, we will kill you like that.” But he was smart.
When they brought him the chicken he opened his mouth and put its head in his mouth. Then he bit it off. He cut off the chicken’s head completely.
With his teeth like this; he put its head in his mouth, bit on it and cut it off completely.
He said, “Well, o pasha! Kill me like that! In the way I killed the chicken.”

The pasha cannot put his mouth around his head; his head is too big. He said, “Gosh, I cannot kill you like that, there is no killing like that. Brother, you are pardoned! I cannot kill you like that”.
It means (he said), “You are pardoned.” The pasha bestowed a pardon on him and said, “Go away, you are free! You are smart, you are an intelligent man.” He defeated him with brightness, with wits.
